titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the David Sedaris Papers
titlestmt.author: by Rosemary K. J. Davis

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:07
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.Describing Archives: A Content Standard

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Contains drafts and writings from numerous publications by David Sedaris including Holidays on Ice , Me Talk Pretty Someday , Naked , and Calypso , along with correspondence, artist books, personal papers and notebooks, photographs, press clippings, ephemera, and other papers by or relating to Sedaris' life and work.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 32 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 33 (born digital): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 34: Restricted during the lifetime of David Sedaris. For further information consult the appropriate curator.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, Inc. on the Sinclair Lewis Fund and the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2018.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into six series: I. Notebooks, 2004-2017. II. Writings, 1980s-2017. III. Personal Papers, 1964-1989. IV. Audiovisual Materials, 1990-2003. V. Electronic Media, 2007-2008. VI. Restricted Papers.

bioghist.head: David Sedaris
bioghist.p: David Sedaris (born 1956) is an American humorist, author, and essayist. He grew up in Raleigh, North Carolina and graduated from the School of the Art Institute in Chicago in 1987. His works include Naked , Me Talk Pretty One Day , and Calypso . Sedaris is also well-known for his many contributions to This American Life , a weekly radio show on National Public Radio.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: David Sedaris Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of writings, correspondence, personal papers, artist books, printed material, audiovisual materials, electronic files, and other papers by or relating to David Sedaris.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The David Sedaris Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials within this series are arranged chronologically with undated materials placed at the end.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notebooks contain personal notes by David Sedaris.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials within this series maintain the original physical organization found at time of acquisition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains materials related to David Sedaris's writings including drafts, galley proofs, research, notes, and other documentation related to the writing process.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains artist books created by David Sedaris including Heels , Gilt By Association , Atlas , The Early Pilgrims , and Systems of Representation .

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials within this series maintain the original physical organization found at time of acquisition with the exception of some oversized materials.

scopecontent.p: Contains materials related to David Sedaris's life and work including correspondence, juvenalia, ephemera, and clippings.

scopecontent.p: Includes documentation of events and performances related to David Sedaris and his writings, as well as other pieces of media collected by Sedaris.
